name: Biaoshuai Tao
content: Biaoshuai Tao Biaoshuai Tao é¶è¡¨å¸ Assistant Professor John Hopcroft Center for Computer Science School of Computer Science Shanghai Jiao Tong University Email: bstao[at]sjtu[dot]edu[dot]cn I received my Ph.D. in the Computer Science and Engineering Division at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. My advisor was Professor Grant Schoenebeck. I received my bachelor degree in mathematics from Nanyang Technological University. My research interests are mainly in the interdisciplinary area between theoretical computer science and economics, including computational social choice, social network analyses, and algorithmic game theory. Students: Ph.D. Panfeng Liu (2022) Jiarong Jin (2023) Xiaolin Bu (2025) Undergraduate Ex: Jiaxin Song (Now Ph.D. student at UIUC), Yichen Tao (Now Ph.D. student at UMich), Ziqi Yu (Now Ph.D. student at UToronto), Jiayin Chen (Now Ph.D. student at SJTU), Cheng Peng (Now Ph.D. student at CUHK), Chengkai Zhang (Now Ph.D. student at Rutgers) Senior: Wentao He Junior: Xuanxuan Liu, Hao Qiu, Zhenning Ran, Jiayou Shi Teaching: AI2615: Design and Analysis of Algorithms (ç®æ³è®¾è®¡ä¸åæ): 2021 Fall (jointly with Professor Yuhao Zhang), 2022 Spring, 2022 Fall (jointly with Professor Yuhao Zhang), 2023 Spring, 2023 Fall, 2024 Spring, 2024 Fall, 2025 Spring, 2025 Fall.
